DataElement.preferredName: Person Prolonged QT Interval by ECG Finding Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding whether a patient has a prolonged QT interval that meets the criteria for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Prolonged QT Interval by ECG Finding Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having a family medical history, health and disease events of family members and ancestors,  of QTc prolongation, a time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle longer than 500 msec, as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial._An electrocardiographic finding in which the QT interval not corrected for heart rate is prolonged. Thresholds for different age, gender, and patient populations exist. (CDISC)_A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

Property.preferredName: Prolonged QT Interval by ECG Finding Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An electrocardiographic finding in which the QT interval not corrected for heart rate is prolonged. Thresholds for different age, gender, and patient populations exist. (CDISC):Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.longName: Prolonged QT Interval by ECG Finding
Concepts.definition: An electrocardiographic finding in which the QT interval not corrected for heart rate is prolonged. Thresholds for different age, gender, and patient populations exist. (CDISC)
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have documented
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have documented history of prolonged QTc interval less than or equal to 6 months prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is QTc consistently greater than 450 msec for men and greater than 470 msec for women by Fridericia formula, on 3 separate ECGs?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have mean resting correct QT interval (QTc) greater than 470 msec on screening obtained from 3 electrocardiograms (ECGs)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have mean resting correct QT interval (QTcF) greater than 470 msec  for women and greater than 450 msec for men on screening obtained from 3 electrocardiograms (ECGs)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have prolonged QTcF (greater than 470 in females, greater than 450 in males) on screening ECG?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a QTcF (using the Fridericia correction calculation) of greater than 470 msec?
